GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles.description: serves an array of all articles, sorted by date descending by default. Accepts below query parameters.

queries.sort_by: Sorts the articles by any valid column (defaults to created_at).
queries.order: Orders the articles in 'asc' or 'desc' order (defaults to 'desc').
queries.topic: Filters the articles by the specified topic.

GET /api/users.description: serves an array of all users

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: serves an article object by its ID

article.title: Running a Node App
article.author: jessjelly
article.body: This is part two of a series on how to get up and running with Systemd and Node.js. This part dives deeper into how to successfully run your app with systemd long-term, and how to set it up in a production environment.

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: serves an array of comments for the given article_id

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: adds a comment for the given article_id

requestBody.inc_votes: Integer value by which to increment or decrement the article's vote count

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: Deletes a comment by its comment_id and responds with 204 No Content
